title: Cells use 'bioelectricity' to coordinate and make group decisions

aiReason: While scientifically interesting, this bioelectricity research lacks direct relevance to Lman's core expertise (AI/LLM, Web3, Privacy tech, Startups). It's more biology/fundamental science than tech/business. No clear startup or business angle. Already saturated with science posts on HN.
suggestedAngle: If covering: Frame around biocomputing/biological computing as future infrastructure - how nature's distributed decision-making could inspire decentralized systems or AI architectures. But this requires significant interpretation beyond the article.
draftTweet: Cells making group decisions via bioelectricity. Interesting for biocomputing, but the real question: can we replicate this coordination model in decentralized AI systems? Nature's already solved distributed consensus.
